battleships

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleships.Game

  • public class Game
extends Object
    Sets up and handles the current situation of the game. Provides methods which handle commands from the UI and returns information from current game.
    Author:
    strohm

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int difficulty)
        Constructor which creates a a new game based on the difficulty parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • didYouWin

        public boolean didYouWin()
        Calls Shipyard method areAllSunken() and return said boolean value to determine if game has been won.
        Returns:
        method returns true if shipyard has no functional ships left.

      • didYouLose

        public boolean didYouLose()
        If the turns of the current game go to 0 or below method will return true.
        Returns:
        method returns true if turns is 0 or below.

      • hit

        public String hit(int x,
                  int y)
        Method hit checks if coordinates sent by the user through the UI have hit or missed a ship on the board. A hit or a miss will be marked on the board and return a message to the UI of either "strike" for a hit on a ship or a "miss" for a miss. in case of a hit on a area that has already been hit the method will just return "nothing". Striking or doing nothing does not take a turn. Hitting a ship will retrieve shipId from the board by calling the Board method getShips(). The method then calls shipyard.getShip(shipId).getSection(x, y).hit() witch retrieves the ship corresponding to the shipId and marks it's shipSection as hit witch matches with the parameters x and y coordinates. Missing a ship will lower the amount of turns left by 1.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate x where board is hit.
        y - coordinate y where board is hit.
        Returns:
        a String representation of the user either hitting, missing or doing nothing on the board.
